To be successful, an ETD service must o employ advanced technology
o know about and reach its market
To know the market, it needs to answer these Qs: o What is the (main) goal of the service?
o Does the service have other goals (e.g. image-building)? What are the financial constraints?
o Who are the target group(s)?
o Do they use and like the service? Why (not)?
o What methods are adequate for answering these Qs?

Date: Tue, 11 Mar 2003 From: Yunfan Li To: the edoc survey mailing list Subject: Digital Dissertation Questionnaire for HU Doctoral Students and Doctors

Would you please take about 5 minutes to complete the HU Digital Dissertation Questionnaire. The goal of this investigation is to find out how the Digital publishing opportunity is known and used by HU doctoral students and doctors. With your help, we aim to continue to improve the service of the Document and Publication Server (http://edoc.hu-berlin.de). ...

Have you decided to publish online? (34.9%) o Its faster & easier than traditional publishing. o Its cheap. o My documents can be accessed by more people.
Have you decided not to publish online? (15.6%) o In my discipline, online publication is considered informal. o I would like to publish a real / physical book.

Have you not made your decision yet? (49.5%) o I will make a decision after I finish writing. o My submission date is far from now; I will think about it later. o I know too little & will make a decision when I know more.

Suggestions for improving information flow and EDOC promotion
Participants gave many suggestions 3 groups ... and we based our proposals on these suggestions: Inform doctoral students when they start their

dissertation project o Professors, examination offices, ... as informers & promoters o Doctoral seminars etc., within or across scientific fields o Lectures and tutorials within the faculties o Stress the advantages and new opportunities of digital
Send a regular email newsletter Offer more service with the formatting
